intro: Spergularia colorata proles indurata, commonly known as the hard-stemmed sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal and inland dunes. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, and the stems are rigid and covered in fine, waxy hairs. This species is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils through its extensive root system.
